Detailed Description

The Colors class provides several static fields and methods that you may find useful when writing an IRC Bot.

This class contains constants that are useful for formatting lines sent to IRC servers. These constants allow you to apply various formatting to the lines, such as colours, boldness, underlining and reverse text.

The class contains static methods to remove colours and formatting from lines of IRC text.

Here are some examples of how to use the contants from within a class that inherits PircBot;

 
         string boldMessage(Colors::getBold());
         boldMessage += "A bold hello!";
         sendMessage(channel, boldMessage.c_str());
         A bold hello!

         string redMessage(Colors::getRed());
         redMessage += "Red";
         redMessage += Colors::getNormal();
         redMessage += " text";
         sendMessage("#cs", redMessage.c_str());
         Red text (only red would be red here)

         string redAndBoldMessage(Colors::getBold());
         redAndBoldMessage += Colors::getRed();
         redAndBoldMessage += "Bold and Red";
         sendMessage("#cs",redAndBoldMessage.c_str());
         Bold and Red(This would be red as well as bold)

Please note that some IRC channels may be configured to reject any messages that use colours. Also note that older IRC clients may be unable to correctly display lines that contain colours and other control characters.

Note that this class name has been spelt in the American style in order to remain consistent with the rest of the API.

Author:
Frank Hassanabad, http://pircbotcpp.sourceforge.net/
Version:
1.4.4.1

static void releaseMemoryOfCharArray (  const char *  line  )  throw (Exception &) [static]
 

Deallocates the memory of the char * that comes from Colors::removeColors() or Colors::removeFormatting.

Call this to deallocate the memory. This method ensures dll boundary safety.

Parameters:
line The string you retrieved through a call to PircBot::removeColors() or Colors::removeFormatting that you wish to deallocate.
line The string you want to deallocate.
Exceptions:
Exception Will not directly throw an exception but if an underlying method throws an exception, it will be wrapped and thrown as an Exception.

static const char* removeColors (  const char *  line  )  throw (Exception &) [static]
 

Removes all colours from a line of IRC text.

Note that this method allocates memory and that you will have to call Colors::releaseMemoryOfCharArray() to release the memory. DO NOT try and delete this memory yourself. Instead use Colors::releaseMemoryOfCharArray() release the memory.

Parameters:
line the input text.
Returns:
the same text, but with all colours removed.
Exceptions:
Exception Will not directly throw an exception but if an underlying method throws an exception, it will be wrapped and thrown as an Exception.

static const char* removeFormatting (  const char *  line  )  throw (Exception &) [static]
 

Remove formatting from a line of IRC text.

Note that this method allocates memory and that you will have to call Colors::releaseMemoryOfCharArray() to release the memory. DO NOT try and delete this memory yourself. Instead use Colors::releaseMemoryOfCharArray() release the memory.

Parameters:
line the input text.
Returns:
the same text, but without any bold, underlining, reverse, etc.
Exceptions:
Exception Will not directly throw an exception but if an underlying method throws an exception, it will be wrapped and thrown as an Exception.
